result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Yost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 10 days were granted if imposed.
05/26/15 JOC corrected to add Sentence Date

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster. Buy Money of $1800.00 was paid in full prior to sentencing.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. 
Continue with current counseling/treatment, attend at least 1 meeting per week and maintain current sponsor.

COMPLY WITH Day Report Center for 4 MONTHS. Consecutive to Huber. Good Time not allowed on Day Report Center. If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 4 Months of Stayed Huber will be permanently Stayed.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 30 DAYS are Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Balance with Huber. Release for standard conditions. LAST 4 Months are Stayed for compliance with Day Report Center.
Good Time Credit Granted for Condition Time.
Complete 30 Hours Community Service Each Year of probation / extended supervision as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

Defendant Tyler J Yost in court with Attorney Anna M Kees.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Attorney Kees makes statements/corrections to presentence investigation report filed.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kees makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:     IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

72 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 10 days)
  -  36 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  36 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Continue with current counseling/treatment, attend at last 1 meeting per week, maintain current sponsor 
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____30 Hours of Community Service for each year of probation/extended supervision
____DAY REPORT CENTER:  4 Months, Consecutive to Huber sentennce.  Good time not allowed on Day Report Center.  If Defendant successfully complted Day Report Center, the 4 Months of huber STAYED will be permanently stayed.  

BUY MONEY:  $1,800.00 - already paid

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME: 12 Months Huber-1st 30 Days straight time - remainder with huber (standard release conditions) with last LAST 4 MONTHS STAYED for Day Report Center. (see above conditions of probation) Good time granted on Condition Time.
 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
